definitions: having extensive experience and developed skills through long practice in a particular field
treated or flavored with herbs, spices, or other seasonings to enhance taste
examples: The seasoned detective solved cases younger officers found baffling
We hired a seasoned consultant to restructure our failing department
The chef prepared perfectly seasoned chicken with rosemary and thyme
Cast iron pans become better when properly seasoned over time

definitions: positioned on a seat or in a sitting posture rather than standing
designed to accommodate a specific number of people in seats
examples: All guests must remain seated during the ceremony presentation
The seated passengers waited patiently for the delayed flight announcement
The restaurant has a seated capacity of one hundred fifty diners
They bought a seven-seated vehicle for their growing family needs

definitions: directed, facing, or moving toward the sea from the land
examples: The seaward breeze brought relief from the scorching summer heat
Ships traveled in a seaward direction leaving the protected harbor

definitions: in a suitable condition for sailing on the sea; properly constructed and equipped for ocean voyages
examples: The inspector certified the vessel as seaworthy after extensive repairs
Only seaworthy boats were permitted to join the transatlantic race

definitions: of wine or champagne: having little or no sweetness; dry
examples: She preferred sec champagne to sweeter varieties at celebrations
The sommelier recommended a sec white wine with the seafood

definitions: sheltered or screened from general activity, view, or intrusion; located in a private or remote place
examples: They found a secluded beach perfect for their quiet honeymoon
The writer worked in a secluded cabin deep within the forest

definitions: previously owned or used by another person before the current owner
received from or through an intermediary rather than directly; not from the original source
examples: She furnished her apartment entirely with secondhand furniture from thrift stores
The secondhand bookstore contained rare editions at affordable prices
I only have secondhand information about what happened at the meeting
His secondhand account of the accident proved unreliable in court

definitions: relating to the work, duties, or position of a secretary or administrative assistant
examples: She enrolled in secretarial school to improve her administrative skills
The company hired temporary staff to handle secretarial duties

definitions: inclined to conceal feelings, intentions, or information from others; characterized by unnecessary secrecy
examples: His secretive behavior made his colleagues suspicious of his motives
The secretive organization refused to disclose its membership list

definitions: relating to or characteristic of a sect or sects in religion
rigidly following the doctrines of a sect; showing excessive devotion to a particular denomination
examples: The country struggled with sectarian divisions between religious groups
Sectarian schools taught specific religious beliefs alongside regular curriculum
His sectarian views prevented cooperation with other faith communities
The conflict had sectarian roots dating back several centuries

definitions: relating to or divided into sections or distinct parts
concerned with or limited to a particular region, group, or area rather than general
examples: They bought sectional furniture that could be rearranged easily
The report included sectional diagrams of the building's structure
Sectional interests threatened to divide the national political party
The tournament featured sectional playoffs before the national championship

definitions: divided or separated into sections, segments, or distinct parts
detained in a psychiatric hospital under mental health legislation
examples: The sectioned orange was easier for children to eat
The architect presented a sectioned view of the proposed building
The patient was sectioned after posing danger to himself
Being sectioned requires assessment by qualified mental health professionals

definitions: calm, dignified, and unhurried in manner or behavior
under the influence of sedative drugs; in a medically calmed state
examples: The sedate ceremony proceeded according to ancient traditions
Her sedate manner concealed intense emotions beneath the surface
The sedate patient rested comfortably after receiving medication
Doctors kept him sedate during the lengthy recovery process

definitions: tending to calm, moderate, or tranquilize nervousness or excitement; producing a soothing effect
examples: The doctor prescribed sedative medication for her severe anxiety
Chamomile tea has mild sedative properties promoting restful sleep

definitions: characterized by much sitting and little physical exercise or activity; requiring a sitting position
examples: His sedentary lifestyle contributed to numerous health problems over time
Many office workers struggle with the effects of sedentary jobs

definitions: relating to or formed from sediment deposited by water, wind, or ice over geological time
examples: Limestone and sandstone are common types of sedimentary rock
The sedimentary layers revealed millions of years of geological history

definitions: inciting or causing people to rebel against the authority of a state or monarch
examples: The government arrested journalists for publishing allegedly seditious articles
His seditious speeches encouraged citizens to overthrow the corrupt regime

definitions: tempting and attractive in a way that may lead to unwise choices; enticing
examples: The seductive offer proved too good to be completely true
Her seductive voice captivated audiences during every performance

definitions: containing seeds; having seeds present within
given a ranking or preliminary position in a tournament based on ability
examples: She preferred seeded grapes for making homemade jam
The seeded bread provided extra nutrition and satisfying texture
The seeded players advanced easily through early tournament rounds
As the third seeded team, they faced easier initial opponents

definitions: sordid, disreputable, or squalid in appearance or nature; run-down
full of seeds; having a notable quantity of seeds
examples: The detective searched for clues in seedy motels downtown
That seedy bar attracted criminals and other unsavory characters
The seedy watermelon was difficult for children to eat
She avoided seedy tomatoes when making smooth pasta sauce

definitions: taking into account the fact that; considering or given that
examples: Seeing how late it was, we decided to postpone the meeting
The project succeeded, seeing that everyone contributed their best efforts

definitions: appearing to be real or true but not necessarily so; giving the impression of being
examples: His seeming confidence masked deep insecurities about his abilities
The seeming simplicity of the solution overlooked several critical factors

definitions: flowing or leaking slowly through porous material or small openings
examples: Water was seeping through cracks in the basement walls
The seeping wound required immediate medical attention to prevent infection

definitions: filled with or characterized by intense but suppressed anger or agitation
bubbling up as a result of being boiled; moving in a turbulent manner
examples: She remained outwardly calm despite seething with rage inside
The seething crowd demanded justice for the police brutality victims
The seething cauldron contained a mysterious potion brewing slowly
Steam rose from the seething hot springs in the valley

definitions: relating to or divided into segments or sections; composed of separate parts
examples: The segmental arch design distributed weight more efficiently than semicircular
Doctors analyzed segmental reflexes to diagnose spinal cord injuries

definitions: divided into or composed of distinct segments, sections, or parts
examples: The segmented worm moved by contracting each body section sequentially
Marketing teams created segmented campaigns targeting different customer demographics

definitions: separated or isolated from others, especially based on race, class, or ethnic group
examples: The segregated schools violated constitutional principles of equal education
Data was segregated into categories for more detailed statistical analysis

definitions: relating to earthquakes or other vibrations of the earth and its crust
having a powerful or widespread impact; of enormous proportions or effect
examples: Seismic activity increased dramatically before the volcanic eruption began
Scientists installed seismic monitors throughout the earthquake-prone region
The election results caused seismic shifts in national political landscape
Her resignation created seismic changes throughout the corporate hierarchy

definitions: carefully chosen from a larger group as being the best or most suitable
examples: Only selected students received invitations to the honors program
The museum displayed selected works from their permanent collection

definitions: carefully choosing some things and rejecting others; using careful judgment in selection
examples: She was highly selective about which job offers to consider
The selective admission process accepted only top-performing applicants

definitions: concerned chiefly with one's own personal profit or pleasure without consideration for others
examples: His selfish behavior alienated friends who once supported him
Making selfish decisions ultimately damaged her professional reputation

definitions: concerned more with the needs and wishes of others than with one's own interests
examples: Her selfless dedication to charity work inspired the entire community
The firefighter's selfless actions saved three children from burning building

definitions: relating to meaning in language or logic; concerned with the meanings of words and sentences
examples: The semantic analysis revealed subtle differences between similar words
Students studied semantic relationships to improve their vocabulary comprehension

definitions: characterized by light rainfall; having slightly more precipitation than arid regions but still relatively dry
examples: Farmers in semiarid regions relied on drought-resistant crop varieties
The semiarid climate supported grasslands rather than dense forests

definitions: partially automatic; requiring some human control but performing certain operations automatically
examples: The semiautomatic transmission combined manual control with automatic shifting
Police officers carried semiautomatic weapons requiring trigger pulls per shot

definitions: having the shape or form of half a circle or a half disk
examples: The semicircular window above the door provided additional natural light
Students arranged their desks in a semicircular pattern around teacher

definitions: strongly influencing later developments; containing seeds of future development; groundbreaking
examples: Darwin's seminal work revolutionized our understanding of biological evolution
Her seminal research paper inspired decades of subsequent scientific studies

definitions: relating to or befitting a senator or senate; having senatorial characteristics
examples: The senatorial race attracted national attention and significant funding
His senatorial bearing commanded respect during legislative debates

definitions: exhibiting a loss of cognitive abilities associated with old age; showing signs of dementia
examples: The senile patient required constant care and medical supervision
His increasingly senile behavior worried family members about his safety

definitions: causing great public interest and excitement, often through exaggeration or lurid details
extremely good, impressive, or attractive; outstanding or spectacular
examples: The sensational murder trial dominated news coverage for months
Tabloids published sensational stories regardless of their truthfulness
She gave a sensational performance that earned standing ovations
The chef prepared a sensational meal using locally sourced ingredients

definitions: perceived by a sense or senses; became aware of through intuition
examples: The sensed danger made everyone evacuate the building immediately
Her sensed unease about the situation proved completely justified

definitions: lacking sense or meaning; foolish, stupid, or purposeless
unconscious or insensible; having lost consciousness
examples: The senseless violence shocked the peaceful community
Arguing about proven facts seemed completely senseless to scientists
The boxer lay senseless on the canvas after the knockout punch
The accident victim remained senseless for several hours

definitions: having, using, or showing good sense or sound judgment; practical and reasonable
examples: She made sensible investments that provided steady long-term returns
Wearing sensible shoes prevented foot problems during the long hike

definitions: made sensitive or aware of something; caused to respond to certain stimuli
examples: The sensitized film reacted to even minimal light exposure
Years of training sensitized her to subtle changes in patient conditions

definitions: relating to sensation or the physical senses; transmitted or perceived by the senses
examples: The patient's sensory perception improved after successful surgery treatment
Children with sensory processing disorders required specialized therapeutic interventions

definitions: relating to or consisting in the gratification of the senses or physical appetite
examples: The spa offered sensual massages using aromatic essential oils
His sensual poetry celebrated physical pleasure and earthly delights

definitions: relating to or affecting the senses rather than the intellect; aesthetically pleasing
examples: The artist created sensuous sculptures with smooth, flowing curves
She enjoyed the sensuous feeling of silk against her skin

definitions: caused to go or be taken to a destination; dispatched
examples: The sent package arrived earlier than expected at its destination
All sent messages were stored in the email outbox folder

definitions: able to perceive or feel things; having consciousness and the capacity for sensation
examples: Scientists debated whether artificial intelligence could become truly sentient
Animal rights activists argued that all sentient beings deserve protection

definitions: prompted by feelings of tenderness, sadness, or nostalgia, often excessively so
examples: She kept sentimental items from childhood in a special memory box
His sentimental attachment to the house prevented him from selling
